trans-unit.source: In addition to using voice commands within Cortana to access system features, you can also extend Cortana with features and functionality from a background app using voice commands that specify an action or command to execute within the app.
trans-unit.target: In addition to using voice commands within Cortana to access system features, you can also extend Cortana with features and functionality from a background app using voice commands that specify an action or command to execute within the app.

trans-unit.source: Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana
trans-unit.target: Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana

trans-unit.source: Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana
trans-unit.target: Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

trans-unit.source: VCD elements and attributes v1.2
trans-unit.target: VCD elements and attributes v1.2

trans-unit.source: In addition to using voice commands within **Cortana** to access system features, you can also extend **Cortana** with features and functionality from a background app using voice commands that specify an action or command to execute within the app.
trans-unit.target: In addition to using voice commands within **Cortana** to access system features, you can also extend **Cortana** with features and functionality from a background app using voice commands that specify an action or command to execute within the app.

trans-unit.source: When an app handles a voice command in the background, it can display feedback on the **Cortana** canvas and communicate with the user using the **Cortana** voice.
trans-unit.target: When an app handles a voice command in the background, it can display feedback on the **Cortana** canvas and communicate with the user using the **Cortana** voice.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: A voice command is a single utterance with a specific intent, defined in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file, directed at an installed app through **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: A voice command is a single utterance with a specific intent, defined in a Voice Command Definition (VCD) file, directed at an installed app through **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: A voice command definition can vary in complexity.
trans-unit.target: A voice command definition can vary in complexity.

trans-unit.source: It can support anything from a single, constrained utterance to a collection of more flexible, natural language utterances, all denoting the same intent.
trans-unit.target: It can support anything from a single, constrained utterance to a collection of more flexible, natural language utterances, all denoting the same intent.

trans-unit.source: A VCD file defines one or more voice commands, each with a unique intent.
trans-unit.target: A VCD file defines one or more voice commands, each with a unique intent.

trans-unit.source: The target app can be launched in the foreground (the app takes focus) or activated in the background (**Cortana** retains focus but provides results from the app), depending on the complexity of the interaction.
trans-unit.target: The target app can be launched in the foreground (the app takes focus) or activated in the background (**Cortana** retains focus but provides results from the app), depending on the complexity of the interaction.

trans-unit.source: For example, voice commands that require additional context or user input (such as sending a message to a specific contact) are best handled in a foreground app, while basic commands can be handled in **Cortana** through a background app.
trans-unit.target: For example, voice commands that require additional context or user input (such as sending a message to a specific contact) are best handled in a foreground app, while basic commands can be handled in **Cortana** through a background app.

trans-unit.source: We demonstrate these features here with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works** from the [Cortana voice command sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=619899).
trans-unit.target: We demonstrate these features here with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works** from the [Cortana voice command sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=619899).

trans-unit.source: Here's an overview of the **Adventure Works** app integrated with the **Cortana** canvas.
trans-unit.target: Here's an overview of the **Adventure Works** app integrated with the **Cortana** canvas.

trans-unit.source: cortana canvas overview
trans-unit.target: cortana canvas overview

trans-unit.source: To view an **Adventure Works** trip without **Cortana**, a user would launch the app and navigate to the **Upcoming trips** page.
trans-unit.target: To view an **Adventure Works** trip without **Cortana**, a user would launch the app and navigate to the **Upcoming trips** page.

trans-unit.source: Using voice commands through **Cortana** to launch your app in the background, the user can instead just say, "Adventure Works, when is my trip to Las Vegas?".
trans-unit.target: Using voice commands through **Cortana** to launch your app in the background, the user can instead just say, "Adventure Works, when is my trip to Las Vegas?".

trans-unit.source: Your app handles the command and **Cortana** displays results along with your app icon and other app info, if provided.
trans-unit.target: Your app handles the command and **Cortana** displays results along with your app icon and other app info, if provided.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a basic trip query and **Cortana** result screen that both shows and speaks "Your next trip to Las Vegas is on August 1st".
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a basic trip query and **Cortana** result screen that both shows and speaks "Your next trip to Las Vegas is on August 1st".

trans-unit.source: a basic query and result screen using the adventure works app in the background
trans-unit.target: a basic query and result screen using the adventure works app in the background

trans-unit.source: These are the basic steps to add voice-command functionality and extend **Cortana** with background functionality from your app using speech or keyboard input:
trans-unit.target: These are the basic steps to add voice-command functionality and extend **Cortana** with background functionality from your app using speech or keyboard input:

trans-unit.source: Create an app service (see [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921731)) that **Cortana** invokes in the background.
trans-unit.target: Create an app service (see [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921731)) that **Cortana** invokes in the background.

trans-unit.source: Create a VCD file.
trans-unit.target: Create a VCD file.

trans-unit.source: This is an XML document that defines all the spoken commands that the user can say to initiate actions or invoke commands when activating your app.
trans-unit.target: This is an XML document that defines all the spoken commands that the user can say to initiate actions or invoke commands when activating your app.

trans-unit.source: See [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593).
trans-unit.target: See [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593).

trans-unit.source: Register the command sets in the VCD file when the app is launched.
trans-unit.target: Register the command sets in the VCD file when the app is launched.

trans-unit.source: Handle the background activation of the app service and the execution of the voice command.
trans-unit.target: Handle the background activation of the app service and the execution of the voice command.

trans-unit.source: Display and speak the appropriate feedback to the voice command within **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: Display and speak the appropriate feedback to the voice command within **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
trans-unit.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

trans-unit.source: Create your first app
trans-unit.target: Create your first app

trans-unit.source: Learn about events with [Events and routed events overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185584)
trans-unit.target: Learn about events with [Events and routed events overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185584)

trans-unit.source: User experience guidelines:
trans-unit.target: User experience guidelines:

trans-unit.source: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: Create a new solution with a primary project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Create a new solution with a primary project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Launch Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.
trans-unit.target: Launch Microsoft Visual Studio 2015.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio 2015 Start page appears.
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio 2015 Start page appears.

trans-unit.source: On the **File** menu, select **New** > **Project**.
trans-unit.target: On the **File** menu, select **New** > **Project**.

trans-unit.source: The **New Project** dialog appears.
trans-unit.target: The **New Project** dialog appears.

trans-unit.source: The left pane of the dialog lets you select the type of templates to display.
trans-unit.target: The left pane of the dialog lets you select the type of templates to display.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, expand **Installed > Templates > Visual C# > Windows**, then pick the **Universal** template group.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, expand **Installed > Templates > Visual C# > Windows**, then pick the **Universal** template group.

trans-unit.source: The dialog's center pane displays a list of project templates for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: The dialog's center pane displays a list of project templates for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: In the center pane, select the **Blank App (Universal Windows)** template.
trans-unit.target: In the center pane, select the **Blank App (Universal Windows)** template.

trans-unit.source: The **Blank App** template creates a minimal UWP app that compiles and runs, but contains no user-interface controls or data.
trans-unit.target: The **Blank App** template creates a minimal UWP app that compiles and runs, but contains no user-interface controls or data.

trans-unit.source: You add controls to the app over the course of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You add controls to the app over the course of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** text box, type your project name.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** text box, type your project name.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio creates your project and displays it in the **Solution Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio creates your project and displays it in the **Solution Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Create an app service project
trans-unit.target: Create an app service project

trans-unit.source: Right-click your Solution name, select Add->New Project, and then select **Windows Runtime Component**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click your Solution name, select Add->New Project, and then select **Windows Runtime Component**.

trans-unit.source: This is the component that will implement the app service (see [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921731)).
trans-unit.target: This is the component that will implement the app service (see [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921731)).

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the project (for example, "VoiceCommandService") and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the project (for example, "VoiceCommandService") and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, select the "VoiceCommandService" project and rename the "Class1.cs" file generated by Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, select the "VoiceCommandService" project and rename the "Class1.cs" file generated by Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For example, "YourAppVoiceCommandService.cs".
trans-unit.target: For example, "YourAppVoiceCommandService.cs".

trans-unit.source: In the "YourAppVoiceCommandService.cs" file, add the following using directive.
trans-unit.target: In the "YourAppVoiceCommandService.cs" file, add the following using directive.

trans-unit.source: Create a new class that implements the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) interface.
trans-unit.target: Create a new class that implements the [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794) interface.

trans-unit.source: The [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of this class is the required entry point, called when **Cortana** recognizes the voice command.
trans-unit.target: The [**Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224811) method of this class is the required entry point, called when **Cortana** recognizes the voice command.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The background task class itself, and all other classes in the background task project, need to be sealed public classes.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The background task class itself, and all other classes in the background task project, need to be sealed public classes.

trans-unit.source: Here's a basic background task class for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's a basic background task class for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: Note that we've renamed the default namespace assigned by Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Note that we've renamed the default namespace assigned by Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Declare your background task as an **AppService** in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: Declare your background task as an **AppService** in the app manifest.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right click the "Package.appxmanifest" file and select **View Code**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right click the "Package.appxmanifest" file and select **View Code**.

trans-unit.source: Find the [****Application****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934738) element.
trans-unit.target: Find the [****Application****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934738) element.

trans-unit.source: Add an [****Extensions****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934720) element to the [****Application****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934738) element.
trans-unit.target: Add an [****Extensions****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934720) element to the [****Application****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934738) element.

trans-unit.source: Add a [****uap:Extension****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn986788) element to the [****Extensions****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934720) element.
trans-unit.target: Add a [****uap:Extension****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn986788) element to the [****Extensions****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934720) element.

trans-unit.source: Add a **Category** attribute to the **uap:Extension** element and set the value of the **Category** attribute to "windows.appService".
trans-unit.target: Add a **Category** attribute to the **uap:Extension** element and set the value of the **Category** attribute to "windows.appService".

trans-unit.source: Add an **EntryPoint** attribute to the **uap:Extension** element and set the value of the **EntryPoint** attribute to the name of the class that implements [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794), in this case "AdventureWorks.VoiceCommands.AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".
trans-unit.target: Add an **EntryPoint** attribute to the **uap:Extension** element and set the value of the **EntryPoint** attribute to the name of the class that implements [**IBackgroundTask**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224794), in this case "AdventureWorks.VoiceCommands.AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".

trans-unit.source: Add a [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element to the **uap:Extension** element.
trans-unit.target: Add a [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element to the **uap:Extension** element.

trans-unit.source: Add a **Name** attribute to the [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element and set the value of the **Name** attribute to a name for the app service, in this case "AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".
trans-unit.target: Add a **Name** attribute to the [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element and set the value of the **Name** attribute to a name for the app service, in this case "AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".

trans-unit.source: Create a VCD file
trans-unit.target: Create a VCD file

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click your primary project name, select Add->New Item, and then select **Text File**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click your primary project name, select Add->New Item, and then select **Text File**.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file and be sure to append the ".xml" file extension.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file and be sure to append the ".xml" file extension.

trans-unit.source: For example, "AdventureWorksCommands.xml".
trans-unit.target: For example, "AdventureWorksCommands.xml".

trans-unit.source: Click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, select the [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, select the [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file.

trans-unit.source: In the **Properties** window, set **Build action** to **Content**, and then set **Copy to output directory** to **Copy if newer**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Properties** window, set **Build action** to **Content**, and then set **Copy to output directory** to **Copy if newer**.

trans-unit.source: Edit the VCD file
trans-unit.target: Edit the VCD file

trans-unit.source: For each language supported by your app, create a **CommandSet** of voice commands that your app can handle.
trans-unit.target: For each language supported by your app, create a **CommandSet** of voice commands that your app can handle.

trans-unit.source: Each **Command** declared in a [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file must include this information:
trans-unit.target: Each **Command** declared in a [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file must include this information:

trans-unit.source: A command Name used by the application to identify the voice command at runtime
trans-unit.target: A command Name used by the application to identify the voice command at runtime

trans-unit.source: An **Example** element that contains a phrase describing how a user can invoke the command.
trans-unit.target: An **Example** element that contains a phrase describing how a user can invoke the command.

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** shows this example when the user says "What can I say?", "Help", or they tap **See more**.
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** shows this example when the user says "What can I say?", "Help", or they tap **See more**.

trans-unit.source: see
trans-unit.target: see

trans-unit.source: A **ListenFor** element that contains the words or phrases that your app recognizes to initiate a command.
trans-unit.target: A **ListenFor** element that contains the words or phrases that your app recognizes to initiate a command.

trans-unit.source: Each command needs to have at least one **ListenFor** element.
trans-unit.target: Each command needs to have at least one **ListenFor** element.

trans-unit.source: A **Feedback** element that contains the text for **Cortana** to display and speak as the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: A **Feedback** element that contains the text for **Cortana** to display and speak as the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: A **VoiceCommandService** element to indicate the voice command launches the app in the background.
trans-unit.target: A **VoiceCommandService** element to indicate the voice command launches the app in the background.

trans-unit.source: For more detail, see the [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) reference.
trans-unit.target: For more detail, see the [**VCD elements and attributes v1.2**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) reference.

trans-unit.source: You can specify multiple language versions for the commands used to activate your app and execute a command.
trans-unit.target: You can specify multiple language versions for the commands used to activate your app and execute a command.

trans-unit.source: You can create multiple [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) elements, each with a different [****xml:lang****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) attribute to allow your app to be used in different markets.
trans-unit.target: You can create multiple [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) elements, each with a different [****xml:lang****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) attribute to allow your app to be used in different markets.

trans-unit.source: For example, an app for the United States might have a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) for English and a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) for Spanish.
trans-unit.target: For example, an app for the United States might have a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) for English and a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) for Spanish.

trans-unit.source: Caution
trans-unit.target: Caution

trans-unit.source: To activate an app and initiate an action using a voice command, the app must register a VCD file that contains a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) with a language that matches the speech language that the user selected on their device.
trans-unit.target: To activate an app and initiate an action using a voice command, the app must register a VCD file that contains a [****CommandSet****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn722331) with a language that matches the speech language that the user selected on their device.

trans-unit.source: This language is set by the user on the device Settings > System > Speech > Speech Language screen.
trans-unit.target: This language is set by the user on the device Settings > System > Speech > Speech Language screen.

trans-unit.source: Here's a [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file that defines a voice command for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's a [**VCD**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706593) file that defines a voice command for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: For this example, **CommandPrefix** is set to "Adventure Works", **Command** is set to "whenIsTripToDestination", **ListenFor** specifies the text that can be recognized (with a reference to a **PhraseList** element that constrains the recognized destinations), **VoiceCommandService** indicates that the voice command is handled by an app service in the background, and **Feedback** specifies what the user will hear when **Cortana** launches the app service.
trans-unit.target: For this example, **CommandPrefix** is set to "Adventure Works", **Command** is set to "whenIsTripToDestination", **ListenFor** specifies the text that can be recognized (with a reference to a **PhraseList** element that constrains the recognized destinations), **VoiceCommandService** indicates that the voice command is handled by an app service in the background, and **Feedback** specifies what the user will hear when **Cortana** launches the app service.

trans-unit.source: The value of the **Target** attribute of the **VoiceCommandService** element needs to be the name of the app service as specified in the [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element of the package.appxmanifest.
trans-unit.target: The value of the **Target** attribute of the **VoiceCommandService** element needs to be the name of the app service as specified in the [****uap:AppService****](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn934779) element of the package.appxmanifest.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the name of the app service is "AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".
trans-unit.target: In this example, the name of the app service is "AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService".

trans-unit.source: The "whenIsTripToDestination" command has a **ListenFor** element with a reference to a **PhraseList** for a constrained set of destinations.
trans-unit.target: The "whenIsTripToDestination" command has a **ListenFor** element with a reference to a **PhraseList** for a constrained set of destinations.

trans-unit.source: **ListenFor** elements cannot be programmatically modified.
trans-unit.target: **ListenFor** elements cannot be programmatically modified.

trans-unit.source: However, **PhraseList** elements associated with **ListenFor** elements can be programmatically modified.
trans-unit.target: However, **PhraseList** elements associated with **ListenFor** elements can be programmatically modified.

trans-unit.source: Applications should modify the content of the **PhraseList** at runtime based on the data set generated as the user uses the app.
trans-unit.target: Applications should modify the content of the **PhraseList** at runtime based on the data set generated as the user uses the app.

trans-unit.source: See [Dynamically modify Voice Command Definition (VCD) phrase lists](dynamically-modify-voice-command-definition--vcd--phrase-lists.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Dynamically modify Voice Command Definition (VCD) phrase lists](dynamically-modify-voice-command-definition--vcd--phrase-lists.md).

trans-unit.source: Install the VCD commands
trans-unit.target: Install the VCD commands

trans-unit.source: Your app must run once to install the command sets in the VCD.
trans-unit.target: Your app must run once to install the command sets in the VCD.

trans-unit.source: When your app is activated, call [**InstallCommandDefinitionsFromStorageFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn708205) in the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) handler to register the commands that the system should listen for.
trans-unit.target: When your app is activated, call [**InstallCommandDefinitionsFromStorageFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn708205) in the [**OnLaunched**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242335) handler to register the commands that the system should listen for.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If a device backup occurs and your app reinstalls automatically, voice command data is not preserved.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If a device backup occurs and your app reinstalls automatically, voice command data is not preserved.

trans-unit.source: To ensure the voice command data for your app stays intact, consider initializing your VCD file each time your app launches or activates, or store a setting that indicates if the VCD is currently installed and check the setting each time your app launches or activates.
trans-unit.target: To ensure the voice command data for your app stays intact, consider initializing your VCD file each time your app launches or activates, or store a setting that indicates if the VCD is currently installed and check the setting each time your app launches or activates.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we first define a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we first define a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object.

trans-unit.source: We then call [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) to initialize it with our "AdventureWorksCommands.xml" file.
trans-unit.target: We then call [**GetFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227272) to initialize it with our "AdventureWorksCommands.xml" file.

trans-unit.source: This [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object is then passed to [**InstallCommandDefinitionsFromStorageFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn708205).
trans-unit.target: This [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171) object is then passed to [**InstallCommandDefinitionsFromStorageFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn708205).

trans-unit.source: Handle the voice command in the app service
trans-unit.target: Handle the voice command in the app service

trans-unit.source: Specify in the app service how your app responds to voice-command activations after it has launched and the voice command sets have been installed.
trans-unit.target: Specify in the app service how your app responds to voice-command activations after it has launched and the voice command sets have been installed.

trans-unit.source: Take a service deferral so your app service is not terminated while handling the voice command.
trans-unit.target: Take a service deferral so your app service is not terminated while handling the voice command.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that your background task is running as an app service activated by a voice command.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that your background task is running as an app service activated by a voice command.

trans-unit.source: Cast the [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224802) to [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService.AppServiceTriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921727).
trans-unit.target: Cast the [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224802) to [**Windows.ApplicationModel.AppService.AppServiceTriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn921727).

trans-unit.source: Check that [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails.Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224807) is the name of the app service in the "Package.appxmanifest" file.
trans-unit.target: Check that [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails.Name**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224807) is the name of the app service in the "Package.appxmanifest" file.

trans-unit.source: Use [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224802) to create a [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) to **Cortana** to retrieve the voice command.
trans-unit.target: Use [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.TriggerDetails**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224802) to create a [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) to **Cortana** to retrieve the voice command.

trans-unit.source: Register an event handler for [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204).[**VoiceCommandCompleted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706584) to receive notification when the app service is closed due to a user cancellation.
trans-unit.target: Register an event handler for [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204).[**VoiceCommandCompleted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706584) to receive notification when the app service is closed due to a user cancellation.

trans-unit.source: Register an event handler for the [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.Canceled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224798) to receive notification when the app service is closed due to an unexpected failure.
trans-unit.target: Register an event handler for the [**IBackgroundTaskInstance.Canceled**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224798) to receive notification when the app service is closed due to an unexpected failure.

trans-unit.source: Determine the name of the command and what was spoken.
trans-unit.target: Determine the name of the command and what was spoken.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**VoiceCommand**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974162).[**CommandName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706589) property to determine the name of the voice command.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**VoiceCommand**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974162).[**CommandName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706589) property to determine the name of the voice command.

trans-unit.source: To determine what the user said, check the value of [**Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631441) or the semantic properties of the recognized phrase in the [**SpeechRecognitionSemanticInterpretation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631443) dictionary.
trans-unit.target: To determine what the user said, check the value of [**Text**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631441) or the semantic properties of the recognized phrase in the [**SpeechRecognitionSemanticInterpretation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631443) dictionary.

trans-unit.source: Take the appropriate action in your app service.
trans-unit.target: Take the appropriate action in your app service.

trans-unit.source: Display and speak the feedback to the voice command with **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: Display and speak the feedback to the voice command with **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: Determine the strings that you want **Cortana** to display and speak to the user in response to the voice command and create a [**VoiceCommandResponse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974182) object.
trans-unit.target: Determine the strings that you want **Cortana** to display and speak to the user in response to the voice command and create a [**VoiceCommandResponse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974182) object.

trans-unit.source: For guidance on how to select the feedback strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks, see [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233).
trans-unit.target: For guidance on how to select the feedback strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks, see [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233).

trans-unit.source: Use the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) instance to report progress or completion to **Cortana** by calling [**ReportProgressAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706579) or [**ReportSuccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706580) with the **VoiceCommandServiceConnection** object.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) instance to report progress or completion to **Cortana** by calling [**ReportProgressAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706579) or [**ReportSuccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706580) with the **VoiceCommandServiceConnection** object.

trans-unit.source: For this example, we refer back to the VCD in Step 3: Edit the VCD file.
trans-unit.target: For this example, we refer back to the VCD in Step 3: Edit the VCD file.

trans-unit.source: Once launched, the app service has .5 seconds to call [**ReportSuccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706580).
trans-unit.target: Once launched, the app service has .5 seconds to call [**ReportSuccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706580).

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** uses the data provided by the app to show and say the feedback specified in the VCD file.
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** uses the data provided by the app to show and say the feedback specified in the VCD file.

trans-unit.source: If the app takes longer than .5 seconds to make the call, **Cortana** inserts a hand-off screen, as shown here.
trans-unit.target: If the app takes longer than .5 seconds to make the call, **Cortana** inserts a hand-off screen, as shown here.

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** displays the hand-off screen until the application calls **ReportSuccessAsync**, or for up to 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** displays the hand-off screen until the application calls **ReportSuccessAsync**, or for up to 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the app service doesn’t call **ReportSuccessAsync**, or any of the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) methods that provide **Cortana** with information, the user receives an error message and the app service is cancelled.
trans-unit.target: If the app service doesn’t call **ReportSuccessAsync**, or any of the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204) methods that provide **Cortana** with information, the user receives an error message and the app service is cancelled.

trans-unit.source: a basic query with progress and result screens using the adventure works app in the background
trans-unit.target: a basic query with progress and result screens using the adventure works app in the background

trans-unit.source: Image resources and scaling
trans-unit.target: Image resources and scaling

trans-unit.source: UWP apps can automatically select the most appropriate image based on specific settings and device capabilities (high contrast, effective pixels, locale, and so on).
trans-unit.target: UWP apps can automatically select the most appropriate image based on specific settings and device capabilities (high contrast, effective pixels, locale, and so on).

trans-unit.source: All you need to do is provide the images and ensure you use the appropriate naming convention and folder organization within the app project for the different resource versions.
trans-unit.target: All you need to do is provide the images and ensure you use the appropriate naming convention and folder organization within the app project for the different resource versions.

trans-unit.source: If you don't provide the recommended resource versions, accessibility, localization, and image quality can suffer, depending on the user's preferences, abilities, device type, and location.
trans-unit.target: If you don't provide the recommended resource versions, accessibility, localization, and image quality can suffer, depending on the user's preferences, abilities, device type, and location.

trans-unit.source: For more detail on image resources for high contrast and scale factors, see [Guidelines for tile and icon assets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt412102).
trans-unit.target: For more detail on image resources for high contrast and scale factors, see [Guidelines for tile and icon assets](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt412102).

trans-unit.source: You name resources using qualifiers.
trans-unit.target: You name resources using qualifiers.

trans-unit.source: Resource qualifiers are folder and filename modifiers that identify the context in which a particular version of a resource should be used.
trans-unit.target: Resource qualifiers are folder and filename modifiers that identify the context in which a particular version of a resource should be used.

trans-unit.source: The standard naming convention is "foldername/qualifiername-value\[\_qualifiername-value\]/filename.qualifiername-value\[\_qualifiername-value\].ext".
trans-unit.target: The standard naming convention is "foldername/qualifiername-value\[\_qualifiername-value\]/filename.qualifiername-value\[\_qualifiername-value\].ext".

trans-unit.source: For example: images/en-US/logo.scale-100\_contrast-white.png is simply referred to in code using the root folder and the filename: images/logo.png.
trans-unit.target: For example: images/en-US/logo.scale-100\_contrast-white.png is simply referred to in code using the root folder and the filename: images/logo.png.

trans-unit.source: See [Guidelines for files, data, and globalization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn611859) and [How to name resources using qualifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965324).
trans-unit.target: See [Guidelines for files, data, and globalization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn611859) and [How to name resources using qualifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh965324).

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you mark the default language on string resource files (such as "en-US\\resources.resw") and the default scale factor on images (such as "logo.scale-100.png"), even if you do not currently plan to provide localized or multiple resolution resources.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you mark the default language on string resource files (such as "en-US\\resources.resw") and the default scale factor on images (such as "logo.scale-100.png"), even if you do not currently plan to provide localized or multiple resolution resources.

trans-unit.source: However, you should provide assets for 100, 200, and 400 scale factors.
trans-unit.target: However, you should provide assets for 100, 200, and 400 scale factors.

trans-unit.source: Important
trans-unit.target: Important

trans-unit.source: Valid icon sizes for the **Cortana** content tile are:
trans-unit.target: Valid icon sizes for the **Cortana** content tile are:

trans-unit.source: 68w x 68h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 68h

trans-unit.source: 68w x 92h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 92h

trans-unit.source: The content tile is not validated until a [**VoiceCommandResponse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974182) is passed to the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204).
trans-unit.target: The content tile is not validated until a [**VoiceCommandResponse**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974182) is passed to the [**VoiceCommandServiceConnection**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974204).

trans-unit.source: If you pass a **VoiceCommandResponse** object to **Cortana** that contains a content tile with an image that does not adhere to these size ratios, an exception might occur.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a **VoiceCommandResponse** object to **Cortana** that contains a content tile with an image that does not adhere to these size ratios, an exception might occur.

trans-unit.source: In this example from the **Adventure Works** app (VoiceCommandService\\AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs), we specify a simple grey square ("GreyTile.png") as the app logo on the [**VoiceCommandContentTile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974168) using the [**TitleWith68x68IconAndText**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974169) tile template.
trans-unit.target: In this example from the **Adventure Works** app (VoiceCommandService\\AdventureWorksVoiceCommandService.cs), we specify a simple grey square ("GreyTile.png") as the app logo on the [**VoiceCommandContentTile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974168) using the [**TitleWith68x68IconAndText**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974169) tile template.

trans-unit.source: The logo variants are located in VoiceCommandService\\Images, and are retrieved using the [**GetFileFromApplicationUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701741) method.
trans-unit.target: The logo variants are located in VoiceCommandService\\Images, and are retrieved using the [**GetFileFromApplicationUriAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701741) method.
